lead_paragraph: The three-time Olympic kayaker Norman Bellingham was named the United States Olympic Committee’s chief operating officer yesterday, giving the organization former Olympic athletes in its two top management positions for the first time in its history. Bellingham, who begins his new job Nov. 1, will answer to Jim Scherr, the U.S.O.C. chief executive, who was an Olympic freestyle wrestler.
